file_content.text: I knew those Trandoshans were hiding something. I hope you found the Republic's storage facility full of surprises.
You were right about those Trandoshans. Much more effective without shock collars weighing them down. Thanks for breaking them in.
The Trandoshans are responding to slavery quite well. Thanks to you, we'll secure this wing shortly.
Reform the Trandoshans. Show them your superior strength.
The alien inmates are right where we want them--bruised, broken and terrified of the Empire.
But if I know criminals, they'll be back to their old tricks soon.
We better ensure their wounds stay raw. But we don't have the manpower that disciplinary action takes.
Find the meanest gang of aliens, then deputize them. They'll keep the rest in line.
Recruit some of the prisoners.
A repugnant idea--which, I'm afraid, is the only way out of this mess.
What's stopping you from flooding this wing with Imperials?
Can't you deploy more troops?
Not enough resources. There's only one solution--a revolting one. Recruit aliens to enforce order.
If you want these inmates broken, look no further.
I'm all the manpower you need.
I appreciate the offer, but we need permanent enforcers. I hate to say it, but that means recruiting prisoners.
The aliens here are mostly slack-jawed brutes, except the Trandoshans. They follow a strict warrior's code of honor and competition.
The fools even worship a goddess--some "Scorekeeper" they think rewards honor. Devotion's carved them into fanatics. Now they roam this wing, hunting dangerous prey.
These Trandoshans owe their freedom to the Empire. It's time they repay us.
We will draft them.
They won't volunteer peacefully, my lord. You'll have to appeal to their appetite for competition.
We must break the Trandoshans' spirit. Then they'll respect their new master.
They will lose their faith.
I agree, my lord. But you'll have to prove your strength to the scum.
It's time we introduce these Trandoshans to civilization. They'll repay us with servitude.
How quaint... and exploitable.
We must be clever. Appeal to their base nature.
If the Trandoshans are that gullible, they'll come around. They just don't know it yet.
I'll make them volunteer.
Recruitment should be simple. Just appeal to their competitive side.
These Trandoshans are useless if they won't swear loyalty to the Empire.
But are they dependable?
They'll honor an agreement, but standard diplomacy won't work. We must appeal to their thirst for competition.
So they're insane. That's bad.
As vile as they are, we can win them over. All it takes is a little competition.
Trandoshans can't resist a worthy foe. They'll fear you, but the chance to kill a mighty Sith will prove too tempting.
Trandoshans can't resist a worthy foe. And it's not every day a top Imperial operative comes knocking. They'll be compelled to fight.
Trandoshans never turn down a worthy foe. They'll recognize you as a fellow hunter. And they'll be compelled to prove their strength.
Trandoshans never shy from worthy prey. And they don't come any more impressive than you.
Challenge their leader to a duel. Demand that if you win, his entire pack serves as the Empire's enforcers. They'll be honor-bound to obey.
The Trandoshans will soon obey the Empire.
Consider it done.
If the Trandoshans laugh in my face, I'm killing every last one of them.
This better work.
Don't worry--they'll bite. I mean, well, you understand.
Sure. Why not?
Thank you! The sooner we lock this wing down, the better.
Don't forget my price.
Of course. I'll take care of everything once the contract's fulfilled.
The Trandoshans built their fortress inside a vault. Storm the place and challenge their leader. Make the scaly thugs bow to the Empire.
Those alien gangs will think twice before attacking the Empire again.
I hope you kicked a few of them while they were down.
Blasted aliens don't know who they're messing with.
Captain Vandorn? Commander Calum sent me to assist.
Operations Group Four's honored, my lord. I'm happy to report that our prisoner release program's on schedule.
Operations Group Four welcomes you, sir. I'm happy to report that our prisoner release program's going brilliantly.
Operations Group Four welcomes your services, mercenary. Our prisoner release program is already underway.
Welcome to Operations Group Four. Our prisoner release program's gotten off to a marvelous start.
We've hit only one hiccup, really. The prisoners here--they're gangs of rabid aliens. Formerly members of some Republic experiment.
The gangs attack the Republic as planned, but they're also tormenting our boys. Now there's a large number of berserk aliens between us and the Dread Masters.
I don't care how ferocious these prisoners are. I'll reach the Dread Masters.
Aliens won't stop me.
Even if you find the Sith Lords, we need this area secure for their escape. My team's instilling order now, and--excuse me....
A prison break needs a clear escape route.
Then how will we get them out?
Not to worry. Operations Group Four's on the job. We'll have those aliens killed or back in their cells in no--excuse me....
Do I detect a hint of repulsion towards non-humans, Captain?
Have a problem with aliens?
Only the criminal element. I'd never lump someone of your caliber in with these--excuse me....
This isn't your lucky day.
I have everything under control. Operations Group Four's clearing out the aliens, and--excuse me....
One more step and I'll--! Oh... so sorry. Thought you were a prisoner. Please accept my apologies.
Belsavis isn't safe to travel alone. But if you got this far, maybe you could help.
Good to see friendlies so far from home base. Stay a moment. You're about to walk right into a battlefield.
I'm Captain Vandorn, head of Operations Group Four. We just unleashed enough vicious alien prisoners to keep the Republic busy for months.
Then we hit a hiccup. The alien gangs went berserk, attacking Imperial and Republic alike. We need to restore order, ASAP.
Send your operations group into the field. Knock some alien skulls.
Lay down the law.
I'm on top of it. My team's already out there, rounding up the inmates and--excuse me....
The longer these inmates run loose, the more Republic meat they chew.
What's the rush?
These aliens are more lethal than expected. Operations Group Four's fighting to slow their advance and--excuse me....
A mob of prisoners shouldn't be too hard to control.
Can't handle a few aliens?
Operations Group Four can handle anything. My team's out there now, beating the bushes and--excuse me....
Captain Vandorn speaking. Dead? All of them? No--that's impossible! Well, stop blabbering and--Sergeant? Sergeant?
The alien gangs have wiped out Operations Group Four. We've lost control of this wing.
Where the military falls, Captain, a Sith will triumph.
I will take it back.
Belsavis twisted these aliens into savage killers. Your lightsaber's just what they deserve!
So the aliens developed a taste for Imperial blood. I know just the cure.
I'll take it back.
Thank you, my lord. Only Sith can bring such brutal degenerates in line!
It's time these aliens taste Imperial justice.
I could help.
These criminals are bloodthirsty lunatics. Discipline's just what they need!
Bringing these aliens in line will cost you.
I could help, for a price.
If credits will bury them, so be it. But be careful. Belsavis twisted those aliens into brutal lunatics.
A child could see the danger of unleashing hordes of frenzied aliens.
You screwed up, Captain.
I--I followed Commander Calum's orders exactly. Still--this can be fixed.
Don't shed a tear over them.
You're right. But my entire outfit... gone.
I knew these aliens were brutal--that's why we released them. But they've crossed a line!
Carve up their top gangs and make the aliens fear us. Then we'll be able to evacuate the Dread Masters.
We need to show them who's in charge. Carve up their most aggressive gangs, and you'll give the alien filth a reason to fear us.
Stay here and secure the outpost. Leave the prisoners to me.
I'll thin out the aliens.
Watch an expert at work.
Thank you. Gun for the Gamorreans, Anomids and Gand. They're the fiercest scum of the bunch.
Kill enough members of each gang, and they'll learn to respect the Empire!
Count me out.
Please reconsider. We can't free the Dread Masters until this wing's secure.
We can't let this alien scum run us out. Let me know if you change your mind.
Operations Group Four has everything under control.
I suppose someone has to.
